column2: Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies. As you increase your levy laws your vassals will become less happy with you, and might even rebel or plot to reduce the crown levies.
Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies.
Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies.
Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies.
Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies.
Crown Levies dictate how many levies vassals have to give you, which will override their opinion of you and your demesne laws if they'd result in less levies.
The King's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon.
The King's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will be able to declare war upon anyone as long as they have a valid casus belli.
The King's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will not be able to declare war upon other vassals unless they're rebelling against them.
The King's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will not be able to declare war upon anyone unless they're rebelling against them.
The Emperor's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon.
The Emperor's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will be able to declare war upon anyone as long as they have a valid casus belli.
The Emperor's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will not be able to declare war upon other vassals unless they're rebelling against them.
The Emperor's Peace dictates who vassals can declare war upon. At this level they will not be able to declare war upon anyone unless they're rebelling against them.
Title Revocation decides if characters can revoke their vassals' titles.
Title Revocation decides if characters can revoke their vassals' titles. At this level revocation is not possible.
Title Revocation decides if characters can revoke their vassals' titles. At this level revocation is possible but will give a major opinion penalty with all vassals unless you have a valid reason.

Title Revocation decides if characters can revoke their vassals' titles. At this level revocation is possible but will give a major opinion penalty with all vassals unless you have a valid reason. At this level being an infidel or heretic is considered a valid reason.
External Inheritance controls whether characters outside the realm can inherit.
External Inheritance controls whether characters outside the realm can inherit. At this level they're able to inherit realm titles.
External Inheritance controls whether characters outside the realm can inherit. At this level they're unable to inherit realm titles.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you. At this level you would be forgoing tax for the sake of levies to a major extent.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you. At this level you would be forgoing tax for the sake of levies to some extent.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you. At this level  you would not be focusing on any area.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you. At this level you would be forgoing levies for the sake of tax to some extent.
Feudal Focus changes the composition of their obligations to you. At this level you would be forgoing levies for the sake of tax to a major extent.
Obligations determine how much your vassals of that type have to provide to you, increasing both tax and levies.
Obligations determine how much your vassals of that type have to provide to you, increasing both tax and levies. At this level they will not provide you anything beyond what the slider dictates.
Obligations determine how much your vassals of that type have to provide to you, increasing both tax and levies. At this level they will provide you a bit more than what the sliders dictate.

This law is used to keep track of the crusade target. You probably shouldn't be seeing this.

Historically the Holy Roman Empire was an extremely decentralized realm. As a result it was effectively unable to attack major external enemies. The Holy Roman Emperor was neither as rich nor as powerful as the size of his realm would imply. It is possible to rid oneself of this centralization, but so doing won't be easy, and it won't make your vassals happy.
The Holy Roman Empire is heavily decentralized.
The Holy Roman Empire is no longer heavily decentralized.

Historically the Byzantine Empire was an extremely centralized realm, but with such a rigid military system that it was considerably weaker than its size would imply. The theme system was at the core of this. It was no longer well enforced, and so the emperor's power was lacking. It is possible to reform the theme system, but so doing won't be easy, and it won't make your vassals happy. A reborn Roman Empire will rid you of the issue once and for all.
The theme system has decayed from its original utility.
The theme system has been completely reformed.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than -25.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than -20.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than -15.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than -10.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than -5.
No direct duke or king vassals (except prisoners) with an opinion of you lower than 0.
